DOC.brief_title: Thirty Million Words- Well Baby Initiative
DOC.detailed_description: The Thirty Million Words Well Baby Initiative ( TMW-WB ) public health intervention aim impact parent ' belief role create stimulate enrich language environment baby . This comparative study evaluate effectiveness promote critical language cognitive development infant low-SES English- Spanish-speaking parent . TMW-WB target infant zero six month parent routine Well Baby pediatric visit one week , one month , two month , four month , six month , final nine month follow-up . Developed English Spanish , TMW-WB integrate education technology scalable multimedia platform . This educational intervention impact maternal awareness knowledge importance child 's early language environment .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterion follow : 1 ) participant ( i.e . parent child ) live 200 % federal poverty line , 2 ) parent least age 18 , 3 ) child younger 1 month old ( start study ) , 4 ) parent legal custody child , 5 ) parent whose child live , 6 ) parent able commit intervention requirement , 7 ) child experience follow condition : premature birth ( 36 week less ) , cleave lip cleft palate ( syndromes associate cleft ) , Neurocutaneous syndrome ( nf1 2 , tuberous sclerosis , etc ) , Trisomy , cerebral palsy , history fail hear test , syndromes associated sensorineural hearing loss ( alport , jervelllangenielsen , waardenburg , treachercollins , etc ) , TORCH infection , Head bleed history intraventricular hemorrhage ( IVH ) , tracheal intubation , 8 ) parent earn currently work toward graduate professional degree ( e.g . M.A. , M.S. , M.B.A ) . 1 ) participant ( i.e . parent child ) live 200 % federal poverty line , 2 ) parent age 18 , 3 ) child older 1 month old ( start study ) , 4 ) parent legal custody child , 5 ) parent whose child live , 6 ) parent unable commit intervention requirement , 7 ) foster parent , 8 ) child experience follow condition : premature birth ( 36 week less ) , cleave lip cleft palate ( syndromes associate cleft ) , Neurocutaneous syndrome ( nf1 2 , tuberous sclerosis , etc ) , Trisomy , cerebral palsy , history fail hear test , syndromes associated sensorineural hearing loss ( alport , jervelllangenielsen , waardenburg , treachercollins , etc ) , TORCH infection , Head bleed history intraventricular hemorrhage ( IVH ) , tracheal intubation , 9 ) parent earn currently work toward graduate professional degree ( e.g .
